message:
CONVERSATION 1
Her: I used to have a huge crush on Prince Caspian.
Him: Oh really? Did he have to sign an autograph for you? 😂

CONVERSATION 2
Her: Prince Caspian was my childhood crush.
Him: Oh, so you had a thing for guys with majestic hair and talking animals? Interesting taste, I must say. 🦁

CONVERSATION 3
Her: I had posters of Prince Caspian all over my room back in the day.
Him: Wow, that must have been an interesting conversation starter for anyone who entered your room. Did they feel like they were in Narnia too? 🚪

CONVERSATION 4
Her: Prince Caspian was my imaginary boyfriend.
Him: Just like any rational teenager would have an imaginary prince as a boyfriend, of course. Did you go on imaginary dates to imaginary castles? 😂🏰

CONVERSATION 5
Her: I still secretly swoon over Prince Caspian.
Him: So you're saying you prefer guys in fancy armor who can ride horses into battles? I guess I need to up my game and join a knight school then. 🐴🗡️
prompt:
I'm creating an AI bot designed to help teenage guys talk to girls. I need you to generate some conversations.

    Here is the sample conversation-

    Her : incredibly sagacious person. 
    Him : yes yes yes. totally.

    An example of a valid answers for this convesation would be-

    CONVERSATION
    Her : im super wise wtf
    Him : of course, Socrates ;)
    ,
    CONVERSATION
    Her : im so smart
    Him : does that mean that our children will be intelligent baby  ;)

    I emphasis this again - the messages from 'her' and 'him' must have the same theme as the prompt. They must be funny, witty and charming. They must be sexy and attractive. The conversations must be in Gen Z slang. lmao, lol, cringe and cap would be appreciated. Make them as sarcastic as possible.

    I need 5 conversations like this, with unique messages for her and him.

    Here is your prompt. 
    Her : Her : this man was mine. prince caspian specifically.  
    Him : Him : i mean he's like a 6 maybe?. a 7?. 
    
    The 5 Conversations must have unique messages for her and him. The prompt for 'her' must be different everytime.
